video.title: Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin (Zero Punctuation)

captions.text: *INTRO MUSIC*

I&#39;ve mentioned before I like to go into a game 
knowing very little about it.

That was easy this week &#39;cos I can still 
barely remember the fucking title
of Stranger of Paradise.

Even now I&#39;m gonna have to look that up 
to double-check it wasn&#39;t

Stranger In Paradise or Stranger To Paradise 
lest I earn the wrath of the Preposition Police

But anyway, the review code came down 
and I said, &quot;Ooh what&#39;s this game?&quot;

and then two hours later I said it again 
with a different inflection:

&quot;Eurgh, what IS this game?&quot; 
The sort of tone of voice a doctor

would use if they were looking 
at your endoscopy video and saw

something with rudimentary legs 
and bat wings.

The second half of the title might 
fill in some blanks: Final Fantasy Origin.

The implication being that this 
game depicts the starting point for

everything that the Final Fantasy 
series has done and been over the years.

And you know something, viewer, 
if that is the case then it would fucking explain a lot.

In defiance of that, however, 
it&#39;s not a turn based RPG or even one

of those hybrid systems I always
hate because they&#39;re like trying

to kick a giant scorpion to death
while programming the microwave,

but a hack and slash dungeon
crawler that&#39;s a little bit soulslike.
Ooh, you were late for this bandwagon, Final Fantasy.

You&#39;re gonna have to sit at the back
with the tambourine players.

It&#39;s called Final Fantasy Origin because 
it&#39;s a retelling of Final Fantasy 1.
Er. Ostensibly.

I mean, a lot of things happen
that are reminiscent of stuff from

that game but they&#39;re like the 
glimpses of distant land you see
while adrift in an ocean of sick.

The plot concerns an extremely 
angry man named Jack who is on

a quest to defeat Chaos,
although whether he means the entire

concept of chaos or a specific 
person or monster by that name
even he seems to be unclear on.

None of which lessens the 
single-minded fervor with which he

pursues his goal, angrily asking 
every boss monster he meets if

they&#39;re Chaos and cutting every 
conversation with friendly NPCs

short if they don&#39;t speedily provide 
Chaos&#39; last known residential address.

Not that Jack is incapable of relationships, 
because he comes

with two sidekicks named Ash and 
Jed who he met on the bus or

something when they all turned 
out to be carrying glowing rocks.

I guess I assumed the four 
Light Warriors in Final Fantasy 1 came

together over slightly more epic circumstances 
than meeting up through Glowing Rock Tinder.

Anyway, in the prologue of 
Final Fantasy 1 the four Light Warriors

travel to a nearby castle to
rescue the kidnapped Princess Sara
from the corrupted knight Garland.

And Stranger On Top Of Paradise 
seems to be doing pretty much

the same thing until you defeat
Garland at the end of the first

dungeon at which point Garland 
transforms into a girl wearing

nothing but a basketball jersey 
who explains that she was also on

a quest to defeat Chaos but
decided Chaos didn&#39;t exist and so

prayed to Chaos to become 
Chaos and get defeated but now
she&#39;s been defeated so she&#39;s failed somehow.

And that specifically was the first
moment that made me wonder

what the fuck this game was drivelling on about, 
by no means the last.

She joins the party and 
it turns out her name&#39;s Neon.

Aha, I said. Jack, Ash, Jed and Neon,
 is this a clever riff on how the

original game would only allow you to enter 
names a maximum of four letters long?
&quot;Possibly. Anyway, here&#39;s your fifth party member, Sophia.&quot;

Well fuck you, game. Incomprehensible
is a pretty strong word,

there&#39;s a lot about the story you&#39;re
just not told from the outset so

perhaps more context would help, 
but it does feel kinda like every

character spends every dialogue 
scene standing around spouting
meaningless garbage at each other.
And this game certainly likes dialogue scenes.

It forgot the all-important rule of show,
don&#39;t talk complete bollocks.

The four Light Warriors gather 
in the throne room of a king who

looks like he doesn&#39;t so much 
get dressed as upholstered,
and he tasks them to purify the four elemental crystals.

So they do that, and then come back 
to the throne room where the same king,

who hasn&#39;t moved, says &quot;What have you done? 
The apocalypse is happening! Just off screen!

If you don&#39;t believe me, ask this mob of angry townsfolk
consisting of ten copy pastes of the same dude&quot;

Would I be right in assuming that 
Stranger In The Vicinity Of Paradise
got cut down a bit during development?

I assume it was going to have a full on
overworld with towns you can explore

full of NPCs that all drivel out one utterly banal 
sentence when you press on their heads.

And all that got cut because the final game
 is a linear sequence of combat dungeons

and cutscenes that you pick from a 
fucking menu that they drew a map on
so you can pretend it&#39;s an overworld.

And I guess they&#39;d already written the 
NPC dialogue because rather than

let it go to waste they stuck a 
submenu at the bottom of the map

screen where you can click a name
on a list to get subjected to one

of the copy pasted townsfolk making an insipid 
observation on the current state of the plot.

Very useful feature if you happen to have 
breast cancer and will only survive by
boring your own tits off.

The budget cuts also hit the 
combat dungeons to an extent,

because so much of them consist of 
copy pasted identical corridors
I was constantly getting turned around and confused.

If you want to know where all the money did go,
I&#39;d bet on the weapons and armour department.
You are constantly being showered with new equipment,

every piece of which is lovingly designed and 
attached to your character model even in cutscenes,

ensuring that the light warriors constantly look
like they&#39;re going to a costume party

as the donation bin in front of
a second hand kitchenware shop.

I wonder if the people doing the face 
animation for cutscenes knew that the cast
would be wearing full face masks most of the time.

I further wonder if the armour department&#39;s
coffee machine ever didn&#39;t contain piss.

Oh the combat? Yeah, whatever, it&#39;s fine. 
Light attack, heavy attack, dodge,
block, other, better kind of block that fuels your special attacks.

There&#39;s a very Final Fantasyesque job 
system that creates the usual paradox -

you pick your favourite job, max out its 
level to make it as effective as possible,

then you don&#39;t want to fucking use it anymore
because all the shittier jobs need levelling up as well.

But combat clicked a little better
after I unlocked a few tier 3 jobs
and made the conscious decision to stop giving a shit.

I mean, all the mage jobs are awful because 
using the spellcasting interface in the heat of battle
is like parallel parking a hippo with a dodgy gearbox.
You also have two NPC sidekicks.

The whole plot revolves around the 
world being saved by FOUR light warriors
but they were probably hoping we wouldn&#39;t point that out.

So you pick two out of your four NPC pals
and it really doesn&#39;t fucking matter which,

you can&#39;t control them and they&#39;re all 
equally effective at being meat pinatas
for the enemies to hit instead of you.

Having said that, they did have some
useful advice in the boss fight with
the undead dragon that kept poisoning me.
They said, &quot;you&#39;d better cure that poison.&quot;
Except there is no way to cure poison. I checked.

No spells will do it and the only 
consumables are the 5 health potions

that get refilled at checkpoints so 
unless there&#39;s a juice cleanse

enema clinic on the other side 
of the arena that I never noticed
I don&#39;t know what they&#39;re on about.
Another thing that got cut, I assume.

So in all, I wouldn&#39;t recommend 
Stranger Along The Lines Of Paradise.

Square Enix, who on Earth would buy something
with so much of it so blatantly missing?

Seriously, do you know? I&#39;m trying to find a 
buyer for several pairs of my old underpants.
*OUTRO MUSIC*
This video was made possible by...
Closed Captions by @willcblogs
